transportAdvice: Varanasi's old city and ghats are best explored on foot, though the narrow lanes can be congested and disorienting; auto-rickshaws, cycle-rickshaws, and taxis are widely available for longer distances. No metro system exists, but shared tempo vehicles and local buses serve broader city routes, and pre-negotiating fares is advisable.

weather.description: Cool and pleasant winter days with chilly nights, making it one of the most comfortable months to visit.
Temperatures begin to rise gently with clear skies and dry conditions, still very comfortable for sightseeing.
Heat builds noticeably through March, with dry and sunny conditions but increasingly warm afternoons.
Hot and dry with intense afternoon sun; early mornings are the best time to explore the ghats.
One of the hottest months with scorching temperatures; outdoor activity is best limited to early morning and evening.
The monsoon arrives bringing heavy rainfall and high humidity, offering some relief from peak heat.
Peak monsoon month with frequent heavy rains, flooding in low-lying areas, and very high humidity throughout.
Monsoon continues with persistent rain and muggy conditions; the Ganges often runs high and fast.
Rainfall begins to ease toward month's end but humidity remains high and conditions stay warm and damp.
Post-monsoon skies clear and temperatures become more manageable, marking the start of the tourist season.
Pleasantly cool and dry with clear skies, widely considered one of the best months to visit Varanasi.
Cool winter weather sets in with cold nights and mild days; fog can occasionally affect mornings.
